docs.snippet: Robert H. Jones, formerly of Salado, Tex., a postgraduate student in Columbia University and an employe of a firm of lawyers in the financial district, committed suicide early yesterday morning by shooting himself in the Hotel Marie Antoinette. No...
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert H. Jones, formerly of Salado, Tex., a postgraduate student in Columbia University and an employe of a firm of lawyers in the financial district, committed suicide early yesterday morning by shooting himself in the Hotel Marie Antoinette. No reason has been given for the act by his friends and relatives, but Jones is known to have been despondent for some time.
docs.abstract: surrenders himself on a charge of perjury

headline.main: COLUMBIA STUDENT SELF-SLAIN IN HOTEL; Robert H. Jones of Texas Fires Bullet Through Heart at the Marie Antoinette. PLANS MADE DELIBERATELY Friends Unable to Account for Despondency That Had Been Noticed.
CARDINAL DI PIETRO DEAD.; Doyen of the Sacred College In Rome Was 86 Years Old.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8. -- The most important stride yet taken in the direction of Pan-American welfare and solidarity was accomplished today, when the Governing Board of the Pan-American Union adopted unanimously the project of the Argentine Republic...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8. -- The most important stride yet taken in the direction of Pan-American welfare and solidarity was accomplished today, when the Governing Board of the Pan-American Union adopted unanimously the project of the Argentine Republic for the creation of a special commission to study new problems growing out of the European war.
docs.abstract: speech at meeting of Pan-Amer. Union to consider neutral zone plan

headline.main: AMERICAS UNITE TO CURB EUROPE; All Republics Except Mexico to Confer on Problems Arising from War. MUTUAL PROTECTION PLAN Rights of Belligerents and Neutrals to be Clearly Defined by Joint Board. WAR AREA TO BE RESTRICTED Peru Suggests Line in Atlantic and Pacific Midway Between This Hemisphere and Other Nations. AMERICAS UNITE TO CURB EUROPE

docs.snippet: President Ban Johnson of the American League returned to Chicago yesterday with the pending negotiations for the sale of the Yankees uncompleted. Johnson said before leaving, however, that the deal would be consummated in four or five days, which is...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Ban Johnson of the American League returned to Chicago yesterday with the pending negotiations for the sale of the Yankees uncompleted. Johnson said before leaving, however, that the deal would be consummated in four or five days, which is taken as an indication that the parties concerned in the transfer will visit Jacob Ruppert, Jr., at French Lick, Ind., within a short time.
docs.abstract: signs as mgr. for five years

headline.main: YANKEES NOT SOLD, JOHNSON GOES AWAY; If Club Is Sold American League Must Co-operate in Strengthening the Team.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 20. -- New and interesting details of the recent naval battle off the Falkland Islands, in which a British squadron sank the German cruisers Scharnhorsht, Gneisenau, Leipzig, and Nurnberg became known here today when Vice...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 20. -- New and interesting details of the recent naval battle off the Falkland Islands, in which a British squadron sank the German cruisers Scharnhorsht, Gneisenau, Leipzig, and Nurnberg became known here today when Vice Admiral Frederick Sturdee, the British commander, and his staff came ashore to attend a reception given by the British and French Ministers.
docs.abstract: reception given to him and his staff by British and French Ministers at Montevideo

headline.main: FIRST STORY TOLD OF FALKLAND FIGHT; British Sailors Breakfasted Under Fire ;- Germans Sank Singing Patriotic Songs. SHIP'S AMMUNITION SPENT Sons Went Down with Admiral von Spee ;- German Shells Harmless on Flagship Invincible's Armor.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 21. -- About one hundred German sailors who were saved during the fighting off the Falkland Islands when the British squadron under Admiral Sir Frederick Sturdee defeated and sent to the bottom Admiral von Spee's ships...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 21. -- About one hundred German sailors who were saved during the fighting off the Falkland Islands when the British squadron under Admiral Sir Frederick Sturdee defeated and sent to the bottom Admiral von Spee's ships sailed from here today for England on board the steamer Crown of Galicia.
docs.abstract: speaks at reception in his honor in Montevideo

headline.main: STURDEE TELLS OF VICTORY.; Says Germans Fought Well ;- 100 Prisoners Off for England.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24. -- Committees to consider the plans already presented by various South American countries for the maintenance of neutrality by the republics of the Western Hemisphere were named at today's meeting of the Special Commission of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24. -- Committees to consider the plans already presented by various South American countries for the maintenance of neutrality by the republics of the Western Hemisphere were named at today's meeting of the Special Commission of the Governing Board of the Pan-American Union.
docs.abstract: committee named to consider neutrality plans

headline.main: THREE NEUTRALITY PLANS.; Pan-American Commission Divides to Consider Each of Them.
